5#ifndef V8_SANDBOX_EXTERNAL_POINTER_TABLE_INL_H_
6#define V8_SANDBOX_EXTERNAL_POINTER_TABLE_INL_H_

8#include "src/sandbox/compactible-external-entity-table-inl.h"

12#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS

14namespace v8 {
15namespace internal {
16
17void ExternalPointerTableEntry::MakeExternalPointerEntry(
18 Address value, ExternalPointerTag tag) {
19 DCHECK_EQ(0, value & kExternalPointerTagMask);
20 DCHECK(tag & kExternalPointerMarkBit);
21 DCHECK_NE(tag, kExternalPointerFreeEntryTag);
22 DCHECK_NE(tag, kExternalPointerEvacuationEntryTag);
23
24 Payload new_payload(value, tag);
25 payload_.store(new_payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
26 MaybeUpdateRawPointerForLSan(value);
27}
28
29Address ExternalPointerTableEntry::GetExternalPointer(
30 ExternalPointerTag tag) const {
31 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
32 DCHECK(payload.ContainsExternalPointer());
33 return payload.Untag(tag);
34}
35
36void ExternalPointerTableEntry::SetExternalPointer(Address value,
37 ExternalPointerTag tag) {
38 DCHECK_EQ(0, value & kExternalPointerTagMask);
39 DCHECK(tag & kExternalPointerMarkBit);
40 DCHECK(payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed).ContainsExternalPointer());
41
42 Payload new_payload(value, tag);
43 payload_.store(new_payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
44 MaybeUpdateRawPointerForLSan(value);
45}
46
47bool ExternalPointerTableEntry::HasExternalPointer(
48 ExternalPointerTag tag) const {
49 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
50 return tag == kAnyExternalPointerTag || payload.IsTaggedWith(tag);
51}
52
53Address ExternalPointerTableEntry::ExchangeExternalPointer(
54 Address value, ExternalPointerTag tag) {
55 DCHECK_EQ(0, value & kExternalPointerTagMask);
56 DCHECK(tag & kExternalPointerMarkBit);
57
58 Payload new_payload(value, tag);
59 Payload old_payload =
60 payload_.exchange(new_payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
61 DCHECK(old_payload.ContainsExternalPointer());
62 MaybeUpdateRawPointerForLSan(value);
63 return old_payload.Untag(tag);
64}
65
66ExternalPointerTag ExternalPointerTableEntry::GetExternalPointerTag() const {
67 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
68 DCHECK(payload.ContainsExternalPointer());
69 return payload.ExtractTag();
70}
71
72Address ExternalPointerTableEntry::ExtractManagedResourceOrNull() const {
73 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
74 ExternalPointerTag tag = payload.ExtractTag();
75 if (IsManagedExternalPointerType(tag)) {
76 return payload.Untag(tag);
77 }
78 return kNullAddress;
79}
80
81void ExternalPointerTableEntry::MakeZappedEntry() {
82 Payload new_payload(kNullAddress, kExternalPointerZappedEntryTag);
83 payload_.store(new_payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
84}
85
86void ExternalPointerTableEntry::MakeFreelistEntry(uint32_t next_entry_index) {
87 // The next freelist entry is stored in the lower bits of the entry.
88 static_assert(kMaxExternalPointers <= std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max());
89 Payload new_payload(next_entry_index, kExternalPointerFreeEntryTag);
90 payload_.store(new_payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
91}
92
93uint32_t ExternalPointerTableEntry::GetNextFreelistEntryIndex() const {
94 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
95 return payload.ExtractFreelistLink();
96}
97
98void ExternalPointerTableEntry::Mark() {
99 auto old_payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
100 DCHECK(old_payload.ContainsExternalPointer());
101
102 auto new_payload = old_payload;
103 new_payload.SetMarkBit();
104
105 // We don't need to perform the CAS in a loop: if the new value is not equal
106 // to the old value, then the mutator must've just written a new value into
107 // the entry. This in turn must've set the marking bit already (see e.g.
108 // StoreExternalPointer), so we don't need to do it again.
109 bool success = payload_.compare_exchange_strong(old_payload, new_payload,
110 std::memory_order_relaxed);
111 DCHECK(success || old_payload.HasMarkBitSet());
112 USE(success);
113}
114
115void ExternalPointerTableEntry::MakeEvacuationEntry(Address handle_location) {
116 Payload new_payload(handle_location, kExternalPointerEvacuationEntryTag);
117 payload_.store(new_payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
118}
119
120bool ExternalPointerTableEntry::HasEvacuationEntry() const {
121 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
122 return payload.ContainsEvacuationEntry();
123}
124
125void ExternalPointerTableEntry::Evacuate(ExternalPointerTableEntry& dest,
126 EvacuateMarkMode mode) {
127 auto payload = payload_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
128 // We expect to only evacuate entries containing external pointers.
129 DCHECK(payload.ContainsExternalPointer());
130
131 switch (mode) {
132 case EvacuateMarkMode::kTransferMark:
133 break;
134 case EvacuateMarkMode::kLeaveUnmarked:
135 DCHECK(!payload.HasMarkBitSet());
136 break;
137 case EvacuateMarkMode::kClearMark:
138 DCHECK(payload.HasMarkBitSet());
139 payload.ClearMarkBit();
140 break;
141 }
142
143 dest.payload_.store(payload, std::memory_order_relaxed);
144#if defined(LEAK_SANITIZER)
145 dest.raw_pointer_for_lsan_ = raw_pointer_for_lsan_;
146#endif // LEAK_SANITIZER
147
148 // The destination entry takes ownership of the pointer.
149 MakeZappedEntry();
150}
151
152Address ExternalPointerTable::Get(ExternalPointerHandle handle,
153 ExternalPointerTag tag) const {
154 uint32_t index = HandleToIndex(handle);
155#if defined(V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER)
156 // We rely on the tagging scheme to produce non-canonical addresses when an
157 // entry isn't tagged with the expected tag. Such "safe" crashes can then be
158 // filtered out by our sandbox crash filter. However, when ASan is active, it
159 // may perform its shadow memory access prior to the actual memory access.
160 // For a non-canonical address, this can lead to a segfault at a _canonical_
161 // address, which our crash filter can then not distinguish from a "real"
162 // crash. Therefore, in ASan builds, we perform an additional CHECK here that
163 // the entry is tagged with the expected tag. The resulting CHECK failure
164 // will then be ignored by the crash filter.
165 // This check is, however, not needed when accessing the null entry, as that
166 // is always valid (it just contains nullptr).
167 CHECK(index == 0 || at(index).HasExternalPointer(tag));
168#else
169 // Otherwise, this is just a DCHECK.
170 DCHECK(index == 0 || at(index).HasExternalPointer(tag));
171#endif
172 return at(index).GetExternalPointer(tag);
173}
174
175void ExternalPointerTable::Set(ExternalPointerHandle handle, Address value,
176 ExternalPointerTag tag) {
177 DCHECK_NE(kNullExternalPointerHandle, handle);
178 uint32_t index = HandleToIndex(handle);
179 FreeManagedResourceIfPresent(index);
180 at(index).SetExternalPointer(value, tag);
181}
182
183Address ExternalPointerTable::Exchange(ExternalPointerHandle handle,
184 Address value, ExternalPointerTag tag) {
185 DCHECK_NE(kNullExternalPointerHandle, handle);
186 DCHECK(!IsManagedExternalPointerType(tag));
187 uint32_t index = HandleToIndex(handle);
188 return at(index).ExchangeExternalPointer(value, tag);
189}
190
191ExternalPointerTag ExternalPointerTable::GetTag(
192 ExternalPointerHandle handle) const {
193 uint32_t index = HandleToIndex(handle);
194 return at(index).GetExternalPointerTag();
195}
196
197void ExternalPointerTable::Zap(ExternalPointerHandle handle) {
198 // Zapping the null entry is a nop. This is useful as we reset the handle of
199 // managed resources to the kNullExternalPointerHandle when the entry is
200 // deleted. See SweepAndCompact.
201 if (handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle) return;
202 uint32_t index = HandleToIndex(handle);
203 at(index).MakeZappedEntry();
204}
205
206ExternalPointerHandle ExternalPointerTable::AllocateAndInitializeEntry(
207 Space* space, Address initial_value, ExternalPointerTag tag) {
208 DCHECK(space->BelongsTo(this));
209 uint32_t index = AllocateEntry(space);
210 at(index).MakeExternalPointerEntry(initial_value, tag);
211
212 ExternalPointerHandle handle = IndexToHandle(index);
213
214 // If we allocated the entry for a managed resource, we need to also
215 // initialize that resource's back reference to the table entry.
216 if (IsManagedExternalPointerType(tag) && initial_value != kNullAddress) {
217 ManagedResource* resource =
218 reinterpret_cast<ManagedResource*>(initial_value);
219 DCHECK_EQ(resource->ept_entry_, kNullExternalPointerHandle);
220 resource->owning_table_ = this;
221 resource->ept_entry_ = handle;
222 }
223
224 return handle;
225}
226
227void ExternalPointerTable::Mark(Space* space, ExternalPointerHandle handle,
228 Address handle_location) {
229 DCHECK(space->BelongsTo(this));
230
231 // The handle_location must always contain the given handle. Except:
232 // - If the slot is lazily-initialized, the handle may transition from the
233 // null handle to a valid handle. In that case, we'll return from this
234 // function early (see below), which is fine since the newly-allocated
235 // entry will already have been marked as alive during allocation.
236 // - If the slot is de-initialized, i.e. reset to the null handle. In that
237 // case, we'll still mark the old entry as alive and potentially mark it for
238 // evacuation. Both of these things are fine though: the entry is just kept
239 // alive a little longer and compaction will detect that the slot has been
240 // de-initialized and not perform the evacuation.
241#ifdef DEBUG
242 ExternalPointerHandle current_handle = base::AsAtomic32::Acquire_Load(
243 reinterpret_cast<ExternalPointerHandle*>(handle_location));
244 DCHECK(handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle ||
245 current_handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle ||
246 handle == current_handle);
247#endif
248
249 // If the handle is null, it doesn't have an EPT entry; no mark is needed.
250 if (handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle) return;
251
252 uint32_t index = HandleToIndex(handle);
253 DCHECK(space->Contains(index));
254
255 // If the table is being compacted and the entry is inside the evacuation
256 // area, then allocate and set up an evacuation entry for it.
257 MaybeCreateEvacuationEntry(space, index, handle_location);
258
259 // Even if the entry is marked for evacuation, it still needs to be marked as
260 // alive as it may be visited during sweeping before being evacuation.
261 at(index).Mark();
262}
263
264void ExternalPointerTable::Evacuate(Space* from_space, Space* to_space,
265 ExternalPointerHandle handle,
266 Address handle_location,
267 EvacuateMarkMode mode) {
268 DCHECK(from_space->BelongsTo(this));
269 DCHECK(to_space->BelongsTo(this));
270
271 auto handle_ptr = reinterpret_cast<ExternalPointerHandle*>(handle_location);
272
273#ifdef DEBUG
274 // Unlike Mark(), we require that the mutator is stopped, so we can simply
275 // verify that the location stores the handle with a non-atomic load.
276 DCHECK_EQ(handle, *handle_ptr);
277#endif
278
279 // If the handle is null, it doesn't have an EPT entry; no evacuation is
280 // needed.
281 if (handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle) return;
282
283 uint32_t from_index = HandleToIndex(handle);
284 DCHECK(from_space->Contains(from_index));
285 uint32_t to_index = AllocateEntry(to_space);
286
287 at(from_index).Evacuate(at(to_index), mode);
288 ExternalPointerHandle new_handle = IndexToHandle(to_index);
289
290 if (Address addr = at(to_index).ExtractManagedResourceOrNull()) {
291 ManagedResource* resource = reinterpret_cast<ManagedResource*>(addr);
292 DCHECK_EQ(resource->ept_entry_, handle);
293 resource->ept_entry_ = new_handle;
294 }
295
296 // Update slot to point to new handle.
297 base::AsAtomic32::Relaxed_Store(handle_ptr, new_handle);
298}
299
300// static
301bool ExternalPointerTable::IsValidHandle(ExternalPointerHandle handle) {
302 uint32_t index = handle >> kExternalPointerIndexShift;
303 return handle == index << kExternalPointerIndexShift;
304}
305
306// static
307uint32_t ExternalPointerTable::HandleToIndex(ExternalPointerHandle handle) {
308 DCHECK(IsValidHandle(handle));
309 uint32_t index = handle >> kExternalPointerIndexShift;
310#if defined(LEAK_SANITIZER)
311 // When LSan is active, we use "fat" entries that also store the raw pointer
312 // to that LSan can find live references. However, we do this transparently:
313 // we simply multiply the handle by two so that `(handle >> index_shift) * 8`
314 // still produces the correct offset of the entry in the table. However, this
315 // is not secure as an attacker could reference the raw pointer instead of
316 // the encoded pointer in an entry, thereby bypassing the type checks. As
317 // such, this mode must only be used in testing environments. Alternatively,
318 // all places that access external pointer table entries must be made aware
319 // that the entries are 16 bytes large when LSan is active.
320 index /= 2;
321#endif // LEAK_SANITIZER
322 DCHECK_LE(index, kMaxExternalPointers);
323 return index;
324}
325
326// static
327ExternalPointerHandle ExternalPointerTable::IndexToHandle(uint32_t index) {
328 DCHECK_LE(index, kMaxExternalPointers);
329 ExternalPointerHandle handle = index << kExternalPointerIndexShift;
330#if defined(LEAK_SANITIZER)
331 handle *= 2;
332#endif // LEAK_SANITIZER
333 DCHECK_NE(handle, kNullExternalPointerHandle);
334 return handle;
335}
336
337bool ExternalPointerTable::Contains(Space* space,
338 ExternalPointerHandle handle) const {
339 DCHECK(space->BelongsTo(this));
340 return space->Contains(HandleToIndex(handle));
341}
342
343void ExternalPointerTable::Space::NotifyExternalPointerFieldInvalidated(
344 Address field_address, ExternalPointerTag tag) {
345 // We do not currently support invalidating fields containing managed
346 // external pointers. If this is ever needed, we would probably need to free
347 // the managed object here as we may otherwise fail to do so during sweeping.
348 DCHECK(!IsManagedExternalPointerType(tag));
349#ifdef DEBUG
350 ExternalPointerHandle handle = base::AsAtomic32::Acquire_Load(
351 reinterpret_cast<ExternalPointerHandle*>(field_address));
352 DCHECK(Contains(HandleToIndex(handle)));
353#endif
354 AddInvalidatedField(field_address);
355}
356
357void ExternalPointerTable::ManagedResource::ZapExternalPointerTableEntry() {
358 if (owning_table_) {
359 owning_table_->Zap(ept_entry_);
360 }
361 ept_entry_ = kNullExternalPointerHandle;
362}
363
364void ExternalPointerTable::FreeManagedResourceIfPresent(uint32_t entry_index) {
365 // In the future, this would be where we actually delete the external
366 // resource. Currently, the deletion still happens elsewhere, and so here we
367 // instead set the resource's handle to the null handle so that the resource
368 // does not attempt to zap its entry when it is eventually destroyed.
369 if (Address addr = at(entry_index).ExtractManagedResourceOrNull()) {
370 ManagedResource* resource = reinterpret_cast<ManagedResource*>(addr);
371 DCHECK_EQ(resource->ept_entry_, IndexToHandle(entry_index));
372 resource->ept_entry_ = kNullExternalPointerHandle;
373 }
374}
375
376} // namespace internal
377} // namespace v8
